title: Momentum as a function of time from force plot

content.question: Using a force probe, a student generates the graph above of the force exerted on a small wagon as a function of time. The wagon starts from rest and rolls with negligible friction in the axles. Which of the following graphs best represents the wagonâ€™s momentum as a function of time?

choices.label: The line on the graph begins at the origin, moves in a straight line up and to the right to time equals 2 seconds, moves horizontally to the right to time equals 4 seconds, and then moves in a straight line up and to the right until time equals 6 seconds with about the same slope as it had from zero to 2 seconds.

The line on the graph begins about halfway up the vertical axis and moves horizontally to the right to just before time equals 2 seconds, moves very steeply down to touch the horizontal axis just beyond time equals 2 seconds, moves horizontally to the right along the horizontal axis to just before time equals 4 seconds, moves very steeply up to just beyond time equals 4 seconds, then moves horizontally to the right at the same distance above the horizontal axis as it did in the beginning, and ends at time equals 6 seconds.

The line on the graph begins at the origin, moves in a straight line up and to the right to time equals 2 seconds, moves in a straight line with shallower slope up and to the right to time equals 4 seconds, then moves in a straight line up and to the right until time equals 6 seconds with about the same slope as it had from zero to 2 seconds.

The line on the graph begins at the origin, moves up and to the right while curving upward to time equals 2 seconds, moves in a straight line up and to the right to time equals 4 seconds, then moves up and to the right while curving more upward and ends at time equals 6 seconds.

content.answer: The line on the graph begins at the origin, moves up and to the right while curving upward to time equals 2 seconds, moves in a straight line up and to the right to time equals 4 seconds, then moves up and to the right while curving more upward and ends at time equals 6 seconds.
